snippet.title: Amber Heard comments on Aquaman role as Johnny Depp fans call for star to be given the boot
snippet.description: Amber Heard has seemingly responded to Johnny Depp fans’ campaign to have her axed from the upcoming Aquaman 2, following Depp’s libel trial loss in the UK.    Last week Depp stepped down from the role of Gellert Grindelwald in the Harry Potter spin-off Fantastic Beasts, after being asked to do so by Warner Bros following the trial.   Not long after, his fans started a Change.org. petition to have Heard, who was married to Depp from 2015 to 2017, dropped from her role in the Aquaman sequel, which has so far reached more than 1million signatures.   Heard has now commented on her role in the DC film in an interview with  Weekly in which she appeared to rubbish any rumour she wouldn’t be making her return as Mera.   She told the publication: ‘I’m super excited about the amount of fan love and the amount of fan appreciation that Aquaman has acquired and that it has garnered so much excitement for Aquaman and Mera that it means we’ll be coming back.   ‘I’m so excited to film that.’   The actor added production hopes to get underway sometime in 2021.   Her comments follow the judge’s findings of Depp’s trial against The Sun’s publishers after he sued following an article which branded the actor a ‘wife-beater’.   In delivering his verdict, Justice Nicol found that 12 of the 14 alleged incidents of domestic violence did occur.   Depp’s lawyers said they want to appeal the ‘perverse’ verdict.    In a handwritten statement last week, the Pirates Of The Caribbean star confirmed he was leaving the Fantastic Beasts franchise.   Depp wrote on Instagram: ‘Firstly, I’d like to thank everybody who has gifted me with their support and loyalty.   ‘I have been humbled and moved by your many messages of love and concern, particularly over the last few days.   ‘Secondly, I wish to let you know that I have been asked to resign by Warner Bros from my role as Grindelwald in Fantastic Beasts and I have respected and agreed to that request.   ‘Finally, I wish to say this. The surreal judgement of the court in the UK will not change my fight to tell the truth and I confirm that I plan to appeal.’   Despite stepping down, the actor will reportedly get his full salary for the film, for which he shot just one scene.   According to the Hollywood Reporter, Depp had a ‘pay-or-play contract’, which requires that he be fully compensated whether or not the film is made and even if it is recast.    The star is believed to have been on an eight-figure salary, and was the highest paid out of his co-stars Eddie Redmayne, who plays Newt Scamander, and Jude Law, who plays Dumbledore.
